description: From Latin hallūcinātus, alternate form of alūcinātus, from alūcināri (to dream).

verbs.description: hallucinate (third-person singular simple present hallucinates, present participle hallucinating, simple past and past participle hallucinated)

entries.meaning: (transitive and intransitive) To seem to perceive things (with one or more of one's senses) which are not really present; to have visions; to experience a hallucination.
(artificial intelligence, of a model) To produce factually invalid information; to interpolate.
